message.content:
<<<api>>>: ImageIO.write
<<<code>>>: try {
  ImageWriter writer = ImageIO.getImageWritersByFormatName("jpg").next();
  ImageWriteParam param = writer.getDefaultWriteParam();
  param.setCompressionMode(ImageWriteParam.MODE_EXPLICIT);
  param.setCompressionQuality(0.8f); // Set the desired quality here
  writer.setOutput(new FileImageOutputStream(var7));
  writer.write(null, new IIOImage(var6, null, null), param);
  writer.dispose();
} catch (IOException e) {
  e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: In order to set the quality of the output jpg, you can use the ImageIO.write method with an ImageWriter and an ImageWriteParam. First, get the ImageWriter for the "jpg" format using ImageIO.getImageWritersByFormatName("jpg").next(). Then, get the default ImageWriteParam from the writer using getDefaultWriteParam(). Set the compression mode to MODE_EXPLICIT and set the compression quality to the desired value (between 0.0f and 1.0f, where 1.0f is the highest quality). Finally, set the output of the writer to a FileImageOutputStream and write the image using writer.write(). Don't forget to dispose of the writer after you're done.
